FuncDef: This command specifies whether the IP header is used in the LAG and ECMP LSR hashing algorithm. This is the per interface setting.

ParaDef.Info: Specifies that only the label is used in the hashing algorithm.
Specifies that only the IP header is included in the hashing algorithm.
Specifies that only the IP header is used exclusively in the hashing algorithm.

Specifies that the hash algorithm parses down the label stack (up to three labels supported) and once it hits the bottom, the stack assumes Ethernet II non-tagged header follows. At the expected Ethertype offset location, algorithm checks whether the value present is IPv4/v6 (0x0800 or0x86DD). If the check passes, the hash algorithm checks the first nibble at the expected IP header location for IPv4/IPv6 (0x0100/0x0110). If the secondary check passes, the hash is performed using IP SA/DA fields in the expected IP header; otherwise (any of the check failed) label-stack hash is performed.

Specifies that this hashing algorithm hashes based on label, IP header, Layer 4 header and GTP header (TEID) in order. The algorithm uses all the supported headers that are found in the header fragment of incoming traffic.
